meanings.definition: The quality or state of being dull.
meanings.sent1: Her face showed dullness as she listened to the long lecture.
meanings.sent2: The dullness of the gray sky matched his somber mood.
meanings.sent3: The dullness of the movie made her wish she had stayed home.
meanings.sent4: The dullness of the pencil tip made it hard to write clearly.
meanings.sent5: The dullness of the knife blade made cutting the tough meat a challenge.

meanings.definition: Lack of brightness or sharpness in color or sound.
meanings.sent1: The dullness of the old photograph made it hard to see the details.
meanings.sent2: The dullness of the music made it difficult to stay awake during the concert.
meanings.sent3: The dullness of the paint color made the room feel gloomy.
meanings.sent4: The dullness of the sound system made the speech hard to hear.
meanings.sent5: The dullness of the sunset hinted at an approaching storm.

meanings.sent1: The dullness of the meeting made her yawn uncontrollably.
meanings.sent2: The dullness of the book caused her to put it down after the first chapter.
meanings.sent3: The dullness of the party made her wish she had stayed home.
meanings.sent4: The dullness of the conversation made her daydream about being elsewhere.
meanings.sent5: The dullness of the lecture made it hard to focus on the speaker.
